intro: Psydrax odoratus f. buxifolius, commonly known as the waxleaf psidium, is a variant of the psidium genus characterized by its dense, leathery foliage. It is a small to medium-sized evergreen shrub or tree that typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions. The leaves are glossy and ovate, with a distinctive waxy texture that gives it its common name. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers followed by edible berries similar to those of the common guava. This plant is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
